oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rejection of additional Civil War pension claim of Shadrick Lee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this letter from the Bureau of Pensions, Commissioner Henry Clay Evans rejected an additional pension claim of Shadrick Lee of Oral, Tenn. Lee served as a private, Co. E, 3rd Tenn. Inf., USA, was imprisoned at Andersonville, Ga. and had reported suffering from "disease of the mouth and loss of teeth" due to scurvy. The letter noted that the adjudication was subject to an attorney fee of $10 and outlined the process to follow if he elected the revised pension, which remained at $6 per month.
